TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and resides in the town of GPE , GPE region , GPE .
CARDINAL . At the material time the applicant lived in GPE .
CARDINAL . In DATE , as a result of an accident , for which a ORG - owned mine was deemed liable , the applicant had her arms amputated .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG awarded the applicant MONEY in life DATE compensation from the “ LOC mining enterprise ( ORG « PERSON ) . The applicant had been receiving these payments until DATE .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant moved to GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , following the applicant 's request to review the amount of compensation due to her , the ORG awarded the applicant a lump sum of CARDINAL and CARDINAL NORP hryvnas in DATE payments from the ORG ( NORP управління по ліквідації шахт ) .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the court sent the writs of enforcement to ORG . The applicant informed the ORG that her written requests about the course of the enforcement proceedings remained unanswered .

CARDINAL . NORP By letters of DATE and DATE , ORG , and ORG , respectively , informed the applicant that , since DATE , the DATE payments were to be made by ORG . However , at the time of the accident the applicant was not employed by the mine , and the legislation in force did not foresee social security payments in such cases .

CARDINAL . In their submissions of DATE the Government stated that on DATE the payment order for the lump sum of ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL had been submitted to ORG in GPE . On an unspecified date this amount was transferred to ORG banking account since the applicant 's whereabouts were allegedly unknown .

CARDINAL . The applicant informed the ORG that in DATE she had been requested to provide her bank account details with a view to transfer her an above amount . The parties did not inform the ORG whether the judgment of DATE had been finally enforced .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is summarised in the judgment of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .
